date.headline: University of Hong Kong
date.text:
Joined the Bachelors of Engineering Program

Major: Computer Science

asset.media:
Information Technology Department

Efficiently managed a database system and administrated a network. Provided technical support and assisted in deployment of software. Devised and implemented a database system to improve file tracking and manage file updates. Also assisted in the installation of a fingerprint system and responded to queries from senior management about on-going projects.

Business Development Division

Designed and implemented a PIN management and batch printing system using Java and SQL for a mobile payment project named Orange Money. Also responsible for graphic design, testing and system analysis related to other on-going projects including a product launch. Working in a very diverse team enhanced my communication skills, broadened my thinking and allowed me to address problems from different perspectives.
Volunteered as a teacher to teach English and engage into cultural exchange with underprivileged children. Over 500 children participated in the programme that lasted two weeks in Chongqing, China.

date.headline: HSBC
date.text:
Industrial Placement

Tai Kok Tsui, Hong Kong

asset.media:
Securities Services IT

Responsible for generating test reports for data migration programs and running conversion tests in the user-acceptance testing environment. Developed data validation tools using Java and carried out enhancements on the internal business system. Attended training for AS400, RPG ILE and CL Programming. Published resource usage reports for project managers. Other duties included extensive administrative tasks, checking connections between databases, performing health checks and debugging batch jobs. Acquired business knowledge on securities and post-trading activities.

Middleware Management

Enhanced the middleware management system to improve and optimize tracking the usage of servers using Java with the Spring framework.

Advanced Execution Services

Migrated an algorithmic trading simulator to a newer generation of the Credit Suisse internal order management system. Discovered and fixed original design issues found in the simulator while also implementing a Market Data. Publisher/Subscriber component to allow the simulator to publish market and quant data to the algorithmic engine. Developed a web-based UI to allow developers to load market data files and perform some trend analysis.

Index Management

Formed part of the Index Management team and developed reliable APIs to process and display information related to stock baskets.

date.headline: Credit Suisse APAC Hackathon
date.text:
Winner of the Hackathon 2015

Austin, Hong Kong

asset.media:
Team Neo

This was an internal hackathon by Credit Suisse Application Development Job Family. Technology used in the hackathon project: AngularJS and Neo4j ( Graph Database )
